definition: to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: Supremely skilled warriors who excel in armed combat and horse riding, they are armed with a lance and mace.
sentences.chinese: 他们装备锋利骑枪和狼牙棒，极为骁勇善战。

sentences.english: Protected by mail armour and wielding axes, these fearsome warriors are effective cavalry.
sentences.chinese: 北欧战斧骑兵身穿链甲挥舞利斧，极为骁勇善战。

sentences.english: Poseidon offered a strong horse needed for war.
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬则提供一匹骁勇善战的马。

sentences.english: The Fan Xiliang of battle of brave be apt to is countries of such a the Qin Dynasty soldier.
sentences.chinese: 骁勇善战的范喜良就是这样一名秦国士兵。

sentences.english: Sir Lancelot was the finest knight in the court of King Arthur, a bravest and most skillful fighter.
sentences.chinese: 朗斯洛爵士是亚瑟王朝廷中最骁勇善战的圆桌骑士。

definition: to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4
